headline.main: At Year's End, News of a Global Health Success

docs.abstract: The stunning drop in global child mortality is proof that poor countries are not doomed to eternal misery. Here's how it happened.
docs.snippet: The stunning drop in global child mortality is proof that poor countries are not doomed to eternal misery. Here's how it happened.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Irish government said Tuesday that it was preparing to allow abortion under limited circumstances in an effort to comply with demands by the European Court of Human Rights.

headline.seo: Irish Government Set to Allow Abortion in Rare Cases
headline.main: Irish Government Set to Allow Abortion in Rare Cases
headline.print_headline: Ireland: Abortion Would Be Allowed in Some Cases

docs.abstract: Irish government says it is preparing to allow abortion under limited circumstances in effort to comply with demands by European Court of Human Rights to clarify country’s legal position on the issue.
docs.snippet: The Irish government said Tuesday that it was preparing to allow abortion under limited circumstances in an effort to comply with demands by the European Court of Human Rights.

docs.lead_paragraph: The measure, which had been stalled for more than a decade, would stock government health centers, including those in remote rural areas, with free or subsidized birth control.

headline.seo: Philippine Lawmakers Pass Reproductive Health Bill
headline.main: Bill to Expand Birth Control Is Approved in Philippines
headline.print_headline: Bill to Expand Birth Control Is Approved In Philippines

docs.abstract: Philippines Congress passes legislation to help country's poorest women gain access to birth control; measure passes after ferocious national debate.
docs.snippet: The measure, which had been stalled for more than a decade, would stock government health centers, including those in remote rural areas, with free or subsidized birth control.

docs.lead_paragraph: Days after North Korea celebrated its launching, astronomers said that evidence suggested that the spacecraft was tumbling and that its systems had failed.

headline.seo: North Korean Satellite Is Most Likely Dead
headline.main: Astronomers Say North Korean Satellite Is Most Likely Dead
headline.print_headline: Astronomers Say North Korean Satellite Is Most Likely Dead

docs.abstract: Astronomers say North Korean satellite appears to be tumbling in orbit and is most likely dead one week after being launched into space; evident failure seems to represent major blow to North's portrayal of launching as complete triumph.
docs.snippet: Days after North Korea celebrated its launching, astronomers said that evidence suggested that the spacecraft was tumbling and that its systems had failed.

byline.contributor: William J. Broad reported from New York, and Choe Sang-hun from Seoul, South Korea.
byline.original: By WILLIAM J. BROAD and CHOE SANG-HUN

docs.lead_paragraph: A series of classes at the Kips Bay Boys and Girls Club teaches a kind of sex education that goes beyond abstinence and birth control to address what relationships need to be healthy.

headline.seo: Teaching Teenagers to Have a Life Before Creating One
headline.main: Having a Life Before Creating One
headline.print_headline: Having a Life Before Creating One

docs.abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column applauds series of classes conducted at Kips Bay Boys and Girls Club, part of Smart Girls/Passport to Manhood curriculum, aimed at helping teenagers navigate their love lives; says classes, which reach beyond birth control education to larger discussions about civility and gender roles, have measurably influenced teens in positive ways.
docs.snippet: A series of classes at the Kips Bay Boys and Girls Club teaches a kind of sex education that goes beyond abstinence and birth control to address what relationships need to be healthy.

keywords.value: Kips Bay Boys and Girls Club
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A city program pairs nurses with motherhood’s hard cases: some in shelters, others abused, angry, despairing, ill and exhausted.

headline.seo: N.Y.C. Nurses Aid Low-Income First-Time Mothers
headline.main: For Mothers at Risk, Someone to Lean On

docs.abstract: Nurse-Family Partnership, New York City program begun in the 1970s, pairs specially trained nurses with low-income first-time mothers, starting during pregnancy; rigorously tested program has shown consistent benefits for mothers and children, as well as significant savings for taxpayers.
docs.snippet: A city program pairs nurses with motherhood’s hard cases: some in shelters, others abused, angry, despairing, ill and exhausted.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Fischer, who already had five children at home in Aberdeen, S.D., made big news in 1963 by delivering five more.

headline.seo: Mary Ann Fischer, Who Had First Surviving U.S. Quintuplets, Dies at 79
headline.main: Mary Ann Fischer, Whose Quintuplets Were a U.S. First, Dies at 79
headline.print_headline: Mary Ann Fischer, 79; Her Quintuplets Were a U.S. First

docs.abstract: Mary Ann Fischer, mother of the first quintuplets to survive in the United States, dies at age 79.
docs.snippet: Mrs. Fischer, who already had five children at home in Aberdeen, S.D., made big news in 1963 by delivering five more.
